description:
Takeo Gouda is a giant guy with a giant heart. Too bad the girls don't want him! (They always go for his good-looking best friend, Sunakawa.) Used to being on the sidelines, Takeo simply stands tall and accepts his fate. But one day when he saves a girl named Yamato from a harasser on the train, his (love!) life suddenly takes an incredible turn! Takeo can hardly believe it when he crosses paths with Yamato again, and he finds himself falling in love with her… But with handsome Sunakawa around, does Takeo even stand a chance?

(Source: Crunchyroll)

tags.name: Shoujo
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult females.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Unrequited Love
tags.description: One or more characters are experiencing an unrequited love that may or may not be reciprocated.

tags.name: Food
tags.description: Centers around cooking or food appraisal.

tags.name: Asexual
tags.description: Features a character who isn't sexually attracted to people of any sex or gender.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

tags.name: Aromantic
tags.description: Features a character who experiences little to no romantic attraction.

tags.name: Judo
tags.description: Centers around the sport of judo.

node.description:
__Hobby:__ Interior Redecorating 

Kazune Kawahara made her manga debut at age 18 with Kare no Ichiban Sukina Hito (His Most Favorite Person). Her other works include Sensei! serialized in Bessatsu Margaret magazine. Also, while thinking of her manga, she often spaces out and brings grocery baskets home. Adores her nieces.  

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kazunekawa)

S.E.N.S. is a Japanese new age instrumental group formed in 1988, originally with two members. The name stands for "Sound, Earth, Nature, and Spirit" based on their spiritual policy.  They have produced many musical scores for TV dramas, documentaries, and movies in Japan, also making it into the anime scene with the score for xxxHolic.

Asaka joined [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/) after graduating from Osaka Designers' College. There his first job was working as an assistant director for [Toshio Hirata](https://anilist.co/staff/117533/) on [Phoenix: Yamato Chapter](https://anilist.co/anime/2999/). Later he made his debut as an episode director on [Yawara!](https://anilist.co/anime/691/), and soon after as a director on [Pops](https://anilist.co/anime/2093). His notable works include [Cardcaptor Sakura](https://anilist.co/anime/232/), [Nana](https://anilist.co/anime/877/), [Chihayafuru](https://anilist.co/anime/10800/), and [My Love Story!!](https://anilist.co/anime/20946/) among others.

Many of his works take on a female perspective for the telling of the story, with a feminine protagonist as the central focus. This has contributed to him becoming the main director at Madhouse for handling the more serious series featuring female characters or targeting the female market.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/高橋ナツコ)

_Note: Not to be confused with the [animator](https://anilist.co/staff/193091/)._

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/濱田邦彦) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/guresam0511) 

Often works with [Morio Asaka](https://anilist.co/staff/100921/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/濱田邦彦) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/guresam0511) 

Often works with [Morio Asaka](https://anilist.co/staff/100921/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/浦上靖之)

Son of [Yasuo Urakami](https://anilist.co/staff/111277/). Brother of [Keiko Urakami](https://anilist.co/staff/162367/).
TRUSTRICK was a musical duo composed of late [Sayaka Kanda](https://anilist.co/staff/112817/) and [Billy](https://anilist.co/staff/267009/Billy).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/LOCAL_CONNECT) | [Wiki (JP)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/LOCAL_CONNECT)

Local Connect is a Japanese band consisting of five members.
**Satoshi Adachi** is a Japanese producer and animation planner.

title.native: さくら荘のペットな彼女
オオカミ少女と黒王子
からかい上手の高木さん
私がモテてどうすんだ
先輩がうざい後輩の話
可愛いだけじゃない式守さん
阿波連さんははかれない
それでも歩は寄せてくる
